<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofpr

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Program Flow

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.85

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> First or second element of array is executed depending on result of [[if]] condition. Result of the expression executed is returned as a result (result may be [[Nothing]]).

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> if [[then]] else

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> if: [[If Type]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> else: [[Code]] or [[Array]] with 2 [[Code]] elements. See [[else]].

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Anything]]

</value></part><part><name>x1 </name>=<value> <code>[[if]] (a > b) [[then]] { c = 1 };</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2 </name>=<value> <code>[[if]] (a > b) [[then]] {
    c = 1;
} [[else]] {
    c = 2;
};
[[hint]] [[str]] c;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[Control Structures]], [[if]], [[else]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Any variables you declare within the body of an [[if]]/then statement (ie between the curly braces) are local to that 'if' statement, and are destroyed at the end of the statement. If you know you want to use the variable outside the 'if' statement, make sure your declare it before the 'if' statement.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
